title: Ticket #4642: Avoid condor_history DoS attacks on schedd
description:
Peter Couvares reports that they've essenitally suffered denial of service attacks because of part of the OSG infrastructure running so many condor_history commands, thereby goofing up the schedd.

We're not sure what the best way is to ameliorate the problem. Some ideas:

  • Fork off a separate process to service condor_history commands (but there might still be problems with disk bandwidth).
  • Throttle the condor_history processing somehow -- possibly limit the number of condor_history commands that will be serviced within a certain time window, or limit the number of concurrent condor_history commands (if the command keeps an open connection to the schedd).
remarks:
2014-Oct-09 16:02:57 by tannenba:
The schedd already does fork off a separate process to service condor_history commands.

Also, remote condor_history queries can already be throttled. But I am not surprised you were not aware of this, because somehow these knobs did not get documented! I added ticket #4643 to address this.

Assuming the information in #4643 is sufficient for Peter's needs, I am abandoning this ticket. Peter, feel free to reopen and/or remark why the existing throttling mechanism is not sufficient, or if you feel the defaults are stupid... thanks.
